intro: Crambe gomeraea subsp. gomeraea, commonly known as the Gomera crambe, is a rare flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the mild, humid climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
